title: Getting started with BayesianBombCarbon
text: Running BayesianBombCarbon given dataset involves several steps. key step preparing data teh data_prep function. function takes reference series dataset /sample dataset unknown true formation/birth years. reference series supplied , reference series fit Bayesian penalized B-spline. sample dataset also supplied, reference series fit also estimating aging bias sample dataset. Users can also pre-determine formation/birth years model predict reference series data_prep function. function est_model() take prepared dataset using cmdstanr fit designated model extract_draws pull relevant posterior parameter samples fitted model. Lastly, users can use plot_fit visualize predicted reference series, posterior parameter distributions, , sample data supplied, observed bias-adjusted samples. First, must load R library.
code: library(BayesianBombCarbon)

title: Getting started with BayesianBombCarbon
text: provided dataset data.frame simulated hypothetical reference series damped oscillating linear decay function peak ∆14C. Three columns provided C14 used data_prep function. plot chunk sim_ref_viz
code: # We can visualize the reference series data with(sim_ref, plot(BY,C14, pch=16, xlab="Reference/Birth Year",        ylab=expression(Delta^14*C~"(\u2030)")))

what: Preparing a reference series only dataset for estimation
title: Getting started with BayesianBombCarbon
text: prepare dataset estimation, need provide least one data.frame named columns C14 provide reference series data function data_prep. Internally, data_prep assesses dataset(s) ’ve provided generates named list object two components, 1. character vector flag component tells functions model setup 2. named list data parsed matched stan model format. can also provide specifications knots used penalized B-spline name list values: + knot.min - sets minimum number knots, default 10. + knot.adj - divisor number knots = number reference series data points/knot.adj, default 4. + fixed.knot - integer number fixed number knots overrides knot.adj calculation + spline.degree - polynomial degree, default 3. + pad.spline - fraction range formation/birth years reference series padded beginning end knot locations, default 1%. can also change locations predicted reference series argument pred.. Prediction accomplished within model generated quantities section stan model. can either provide vector formation/birth years desired pred.can provided named list pred.set sequence call: + min.- minimum year formation/birth year prediction sequence + max.- maximum year formation/birth year prediction sequence + inc.- formation/birth year increment prediction sequence
code: df <- data_prep(df_ref = sim_ref) #> No values provided in df_unk, skipping validation and estimating reference series only

title: Getting started with BayesianBombCarbon
text: Now covered data preparation, let’s estimate reference series. function also estimate models checking flag component data list setup data_prep function. Additional arguments can provided est_model control behavior cmdstanr::sample call. Run ?cmdstanr::sample view possible arguments. reference series, default cmdstanr::sample arguments work fine. may wish set parallel_chains argument equal default number chains=4 achieve parallel processing. Though, estimating reference-series models generally extremely fast (< 10 secs author’s machine). est_model function returns named list model containing stan model code sampled fitted contains output cmdstanr::sample. Functions work CmdStanMCMC objects produced cmdstanr::sample also work fit$fitted object.

title: Getting started with BayesianBombCarbon
text: Posterior draws parameters can accomplished calling cmdstanr::draws fit$fitted CmdStanMCMC object produced est_model wrapper function provided extract_draws grabs relevant parameters based model type estimated. wrapper function inherently skips nuisance parameters estimated pertaining knots penalized B-spline.
code: ext <- extract_draws(fit = fit)

title: Getting started with BayesianBombCarbon
text: Lastly, can visualize model fit using plot_fit. function takes data object data_prep extracted draws extract_draws generate plot. plot chunk plot_ref_viz
code: plot_fit(df = df, ext = ext)

what: Integrated method - reference series + unvalidated samples
title: Getting started with BayesianBombCarbon
text: BayesianBombCarbon also integrated method jointly estimating reference series aging bias present set samples unvalidated formation/birth years. penalized B-spline, requires adjusting knot contribution unvalidated sample time new aging bias (formation/birth year adjustment) trialed. massively increases runtime , author’s biased opinion, well worth wait. setup similar reference series estimation.

previous_headings: Integrated method - reference series + unvalidated samples
title: Getting started with BayesianBombCarbon
text: can used provided simulated reference series data sim_ref accompanying unvalidated simulated samples sim_unk. latter fixed aging bias +1 year. plot chunk sim_unk_viz need supply two data.frames named columns C14. One reference series, provided argument df_ref, another unvalidated samples, provide arugment df_unk data_prep function. additional argument ll_wt added $data object data_prep call -weights reference series data relative unvalidated samples. keep reference series estimation chasing unvalidated samples. set default 5 reference series spotty unvalidated samples, may wish increase value. associated runtime cost.
code: # We can visualize the reference series data with(sim_ref, plot(BY,C14, pch=16, xlab="Reference/Birth Year",        ylab=expression(Delta^14*C~"(\u2030)"), las = 1)) with(sim_unk,points(BY,C14,pch=16,col='red')) legend('topleft', legend = c('Reference','Test'), pch = 16, col = c('black','red')) df_int <- data_prep(df_ref = sim_ref, df_unk = sim_unk)

previous_headings: Integrated method - reference series + unvalidated samples
title: Getting started with BayesianBombCarbon
text: Just reference series estimation, call est_model estimate integrated model. recommend adjusting cmdnstanr::sample arguments running integrated model least increase warmup iterations. also recommend setting parallel processing parallel_chains argument models longer runtimes. may also receive warning transistions hit maximum treedepth 10. can resolved changing max_treedepth argument > 10.
code: fit_int <- est_model(data = df_int, iter_warmup = 3000, parallel_chains = 4, show_messages = FALSE, show_exceptions = FALSE)

previous_headings: Integrated method - reference series + unvalidated samples
title: Getting started with BayesianBombCarbon
text: Just , can extract posterior draws using extract_draws wrapper function. Note, provide data_prep object df argument additional posterior generated BY_adj, adjusts unvalidated formation/birth years posterior aging bias/adjustment.
code: ext_int <- extract_draws(fit = fit_int, df = df_int)

previous_headings: Integrated method - reference series + unvalidated samples
title: Getting started with BayesianBombCarbon
text: posterior parameter draws integrated model, can conduct formal hypothesis testing whether ages valid. explicit advantage integrated approach traditional sum square approaches . , recommend bayestestR package. returns Bayesian equivalent p-value, see ?bayestestR::p_map details. argument null can changed also explicitly test null ages ask “aging bias significantly X?”.
code: library(bayestestR) p_map(ext_int$adj, null = 0) #> MAP-based p-value #>  #> Parameter | p (MAP) #> ------------------- #> adj       |  < .001

previous_headings: Integrated method - reference series + unvalidated samples
title: Getting started with BayesianBombCarbon
text: Lastly, can visualize integrated model using plot_fit. Visualization reference function fit, adjusted unvalidated samples, posterior distributions Note additional features plotted. original unvalidated formation/birth years shown red circles adjusted formation/birth years, along credible interval, shown red ticks. Additional, posterior densities aging bias/adjustment provided. vertical, dashed red segment highlight zero posterior overlaps adjacent zero. provides visual equivalent hypothesis test conducted earlier.
code: plot_fit(df = df_int, ext = ext_int)

title: Getting started with BayesianBombCarbon
text: BayesianBombCarbon development though core functionality remain mostly unchanged future. Additional models provided, coupled function Kastelle et al. (2011), reference series integrated method capabilities. General improvements also made sum squares aging bias estimation approach, first presented Kastelle et al. (2008), supported soon. suggestions/requests/bugs, please reach zsiders@ufl.edu.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Zachary Siders. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Siders Z (2025). BayesianBombCarbon: Estimate Bayesian Bomb Radiocarbon Models. R package version 2.1.2, https://zsiders.github.io/BayesianBombCarbon/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {BayesianBombCarbon: Estimate Bayesian Bomb Radiocarbon Models},   author = {Zachary Siders},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 2.1.2},   url = {https://zsiders.github.io/BayesianBombCarbon/}, }

title: Estimate Bayesian Bomb Radiocarbon Models
text: Bayesian methods including penalized B-splines fitting bomb radiocarbon reference series assessing aging bias

title: Estimate Bayesian Bomb Radiocarbon Models
text: BayesianBombCarbon R package provides Bayesian models stan estimate ∆14C reference series, estimate aging bias samples unvalidated formation/birth years given reference series, assess aging samples valid via hypothesis testing. Currently, reference series fit using Bayesian penalized B-spline random walk prior control degree smoothing, first presented Chamberlin et al. 2023.

title: Estimate Bayesian Bomb Radiocarbon Models
text: development version BayesianBombCarbon can installed GitHub shown . Please note package still early development may subject breaking changes. BayesianBombCarbon also requires CmdStan installed system. can done using install_cmdstan() function cmdstanr. experience problems installing CmdStan, see cmdstanr vignette help. stan models used BayesianBombCarbon need compiled device. necessary - installing updating package - can done using bombcarbon_compile() function. models successfully compiled, please ensure cmdstan properly set try updating newer version using cmdstanr::install_cmdstan(). problem persists, please run BayesianBombCarbon::bombcarbon_compile(verbose = TRUE) post output new issue GitHub, along cmdstanr::cmdstan_version().
code: remotes::install_github("zsiders/BayesianBombCarbon", dependencies = TRUE) cmdstanr::check_cmdstan_toolchain() cmdstanr::install_cmdstan(cores = 2) # use more cores to speed up BayesianBombCarbon::bombcarbon_compile()

title: Compile BayesianBombCarbon STAN models — bombcarbon_compile
text: stan models used BayesianBombCarbon need compiled device. necessary , installing updating package. function compiles models package.

title: Compile BayesianBombCarbon STAN models — bombcarbon_compile
code: bombcarbon_compile(model = NULL, force_recompile = FALSE, verbose = FALSE)

title: Compile BayesianBombCarbon STAN models — bombcarbon_compile
text: model character vector specific model compile. NULL (default), models compiled. force_recompile TRUE, models recompiled even already successfully compiled. verbose TRUE, warnings detailed errors compilation  printed. can help diagnose compilation issues.

title: Compile BayesianBombCarbon STAN models — bombcarbon_compile
text: one several models successfully compiled, please ensure cmdstan properly set try updating newer version using cmdstanr::install_cmdstan(). problem persists, please run bombcarbon_compile(verbose = TRUE) post output new issue GitHub, along cmdstanr::cmdstan_version().

what: Prepares data for Bayesian penalized B-spline — data_prep
title: Prepares data for Bayesian penalized B-spline — data_prep
text: Forces standardized format inputting bomb radidocarbon data list object estimating 'cmdstanr'

title: Prepares data for Bayesian penalized B-spline — data_prep
code: data_prep(   df_ref,   df_unk,   model = "bspline",   ll_wt = 5,   pred.by = list(min.by = 1940, max.by = 2020, inc.by = 1),   adj_prior = NULL,   bspline.control = list(knot.min = 10, knot.adj = 4, fixed.knot = NULL, spline.degree =     3, pad.spline = 0.01) )

title: Prepares data for Bayesian penalized B-spline — data_prep
text: df_ref data.frame two named columns reference series data; 1) - vector known formation (birth) years reference series; 2) C14 - vector ∆14C values reference series df_unk data.frame two named columns samples unknown true birth year; 1) - vector estimated formation (birth) years; 2) C14 - vector ∆14C values samples model character 'exponential','linear','bspline'; defaults bspline ll_wt weighting value reference series relative sample values integrated method, default 5 (tested sufficient unless many samples). pred.vector formation years named list object predicting reference series ∆14C . named list needs: min.= start year prediction sequence, max.= end year prediction sequence, inc.= year increment prediction sequence. adj_prior vector two values specifying mean sd normal distribution bias adjustment prior; used df_unk provided otherwise ignored. Default NULL attempts specify weakly informative normal prior. bspline.control named list B-spline control parameters (see Details)

title: Prepares data for Bayesian penalized B-spline — data_prep
text: named list object containing: flag character string indicating model type data named list object matches DATA section STAN model

title: Prepares data for Bayesian penalized B-spline — data_prep
text: weakly informative prior adj_prior set mean zero standard deviation equal difference range test sample birth years divided 4. knot.min  minimum number knots, default 10. knot.adj divisor number observations set number knots, set default 4 number knots = nrow(df_ref)/knot.adj. Increasing value decreases number knots (smoothing spline). fixed.knot (optional) set number knots overrides number knots = nrow(df_ref)/knot.adj. Must integer followed L considered. spline.degree degree polynomial spline, set default 3. Must 0 greater. pad.spline amount years pad spline knot locations, default 0.01

title: Prepares data for Bayesian penalized B-spline — data_prep
code: #default BY_pred, reference only df <- data_prep(sim_ref) #> [1] "B-spline model indicated, adding additional data values for spline control" #> No values provided in df_unk, skipping validation and estimating reference series only  #default BY_pred, integrated model df <- data_prep(sim_ref, sim_unk) #> [1] "B-spline model indicated, adding additional data values for spline control"  #custom BY_pred df <- data_prep(sim_ref, sim_unk, pred.by = c(1956, 1959, 1988, 1991)) #> [1] "B-spline model indicated, adding additional data values for spline control"  #custom BY_pred with sequence function df <- data_prep(sim_ref, sim_unk, pred.by = list(min.by=1900, max.by=2020, inc.by=0.5)) #> [1] "B-spline model indicated, adding additional data values for spline control"

what: Wrapper for model estimation based on data_prep flag — est_model
title: Wrapper for model estimation based on data_prep flag — est_model
text: wrapper function around compiling sampling Bayesian bomb radiocarbon model sets. Flags generated data_prep function used compile appropriate model specific machine's C++ compiler sample model.

title: Wrapper for model estimation based on data_prep flag — est_model
code: est_model(data, save_dir, ...)

title: Wrapper for model estimation based on data_prep flag — est_model
text: data data prepared using data_prep function save_dir directory save cmdstan outputs ... arguments 'cmdstanr' sample function

title: Wrapper for model estimation based on data_prep flag — est_model
text: list containing STAN model samples fitted successfully. model: CmdStanModel object used sample fitted: returned samples calling sample CmdStanModel object

title: Wrapper for model estimation based on data_prep flag — est_model
code: #REFERENCE-ONLY df <- data_prep(sim_ref) #> [1] "B-spline model indicated, adding additional data values for spline control" #> No values provided in df_unk, skipping validation and estimating reference series only  #estimate model fit <- est_model(df, show_messages = FALSE, show_exceptions = FALSE) #> Error: CmdStan path has not been set yet. See ?set_cmdstan_path.  #estimate model with args to cmdstanr sample function if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ fit <- est_model(df, iter_warmup = 3000, iter_sampling = 500, parallel_chains = 4) } # }  #INTEGRATED MODEL df_int <- data_prep(sim_ref, sim_unk) #> [1] "B-spline model indicated, adding additional data values for spline control"  #estimate model if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ fit_int <- est_model(df_int, parallel_chains = 4, iter_warmup=3000, iter_sampling = 250) } # }  #FIXED NUMBER OF KNOTS if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ df <- data_prep(sim_ref, fixed.knot = 12L) fit <- est_model(df, parallel_chains = 4, iter_warmup=1000, iter_sampling = 250) } # }

what: Function for extracting Bayesian B-spline posteriors — extract_draws
title: Function for extracting Bayesian B-spline posteriors — extract_draws
text: wrapper function extracting posterior samples Bayesian B-spline model

title: Function for extracting Bayesian B-spline posteriors — extract_draws
code: extract_draws(   fit,   df,   pars = c("adj", "sigma_ref", "sigma_obs", "tau", "C14_pred") )

title: Function for extracting Bayesian B-spline posteriors — extract_draws
text: fit cmdstan fit object Bayesian B-spline model df data prepared using data_prep function used fit model pars list parameters extract. defaults c('adj','sigma_ref','sigma_obs','tau','C14_pred')

title: Function for extracting Bayesian B-spline posteriors — extract_draws
text: list containing draws_matrix posterior draws parameters interest; parameters return depend model fit

title: Function for extracting Bayesian B-spline posteriors — extract_draws
code: #reference-only df <- data_prep(sim_ref) #> [1] "B-spline model indicated, adding additional data values for spline control" #> No values provided in df_unk, skipping validation and estimating reference series only  #estimate model fit <- est_model(df, show_messages = FALSE, show_exceptions = FALSE) #> Error: CmdStan path has not been set yet. See ?set_cmdstan_path.  #extract draws draws <- extract_draws(fit) #> Error: object 'fit' not found

title: Load stan model — get_stan_model
text: Loads specific stan model model fitting BayesianBombCarbon.

title: Load stan model — get_stan_model
code: get_stan_model(   model_name = NULL,   model_flag = NULL,   model_filename = NULL,   model_folder = "stan",   profile = TRUE,   threads = FALSE,   force_recompile = FALSE,   package = "BayesianBombCarbon" )

title: Load stan model — get_stan_model
text: model_filename File name specific stan model load. alternative supplying model_metainfo. model_folder Path folder containing stan models BayesianBombCarbon. profile profiling run model fitting? Default TRUE. FALSE, remove profiling statements model fitting. can decrease runtime cases. force_recompile FALSE (default), model recompiled changes model code detected. However, change detection fully reliable, sometimes necessary force recompilation made changes stan code. package Name package search stan files (defaults BayesianBombCarbon). NULL, search normal working directory. model_metainfo list containing meta information specified model fitted. required stan model automatically inferred model_metainfo.

title: Load stan model — get_stan_model
text: list containing model definition link compiled stan model.

title: Plotting Bayesian B-spline model — plot_fit
text: function plotting  Bayesian B-spline model estimating reference series /assessing aging bias

title: Plotting Bayesian B-spline model — plot_fit
code: plot_fit(   df,   ext,   probs = c(0.05, 0.5, 0.95),   post.den = TRUE,   legend = TRUE,   min.BY,   max.BY,   inset.control = list(width = 0.003, height = 0.125, sig_low = 0.3, adj_low = 0.05,     xbump = 0, lab_adj = 0.18),   plot_bias = TRUE,   legend.lab = c("Ref.", "Obs.") )

title: Plotting Bayesian B-spline model — plot_fit
text: df data list object data_prep used estimate STAN model ext posterior draws extraction list extract_draws function probs vector three probabilities lower CI, centrality, upper CI post.den logical flag plot posterior densities certain parameters legend logical flag plot legend inset.control list values width (width inset posterior proportions xlim), height (height inset posterior proportions ylim), sig_low (lower position sigma posterior proportions ylim), adj_low (lower position BY_adj posterior proportions ylim), xbump (translation posteriors along x-axis proportions xlim). plot_bias logical flag whether plot formation year adjustment (models test samples) legend.lab labels reference test observations

title: Plotting Bayesian B-spline model — plot_fit
text: figure , invisible

title: Plotting Bayesian B-spline model — plot_fit
code: #REFERENCE-ONLY df <- data_prep(sim_ref) #> [1] "B-spline model indicated, adding additional data values for spline control" #> No values provided in df_unk, skipping validation and estimating reference series only  #estimate model fit <- est_model(df, show_messages = FALSE, show_exceptions = FALSE) #> Error: CmdStan path has not been set yet. See ?set_cmdstan_path.  #extract draws draws <- extract_draws(fit) #> Error: object 'fit' not found  #plot fit plot_fit(df, draws) #> Error: object 'draws' not found  #INTEGRATED if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ df_int <- data_prep(sim_ref, sim_unk) fit_int <- est_model(df_int) draws_int <- extract_draws(fit_int) plot_fit(df_int, draws_int) } # }
